bugprone-incorrect-roundings.description:
Description

Checks the usage of patterns known to produce incorrect rounding.
Programmers often use:

(
int
)(
double_expression
+
0.5
)

to round the double expression to an integer. The problem with this:

It is unnecessarily slow.
It is incorrect. The number 0.499999975 (smallest representable float
number below 0.5) rounds to 1.0. Even worse behavior for negative
numbers where both -0.5f and -1.4f both round to 0.0.
bugprone-incorrect-roundings.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
